body:
Does this also hand if you are not using GRPC_TRACE=api?
What kind of RPC are you invoking? (blocking/nonblocking).
When it hangs, what the stacktrace?

I can answer some of this:
- Yes, it happens without the extra logging. I suggested extra logging in order to help diagnose what was going wrong.
- The RPC is a unary blocking one. (For simplicity, we've been using Datastore's BeginTransaction call, but we originally saw it on queries.)
- When it hangs on BeginTransaction, there's a timeout that cancels the task - I'll let Jeffrey add a stack trace next time he can reproduce.

Blocked user thread:

```
    [External Code] 
>   2-structured-data.dll!GoogleCloudSamples.Models.DatastoreBookStore.List(int pageSize, string nextPageToken) Line 125    C#
    2-structured-data.dll!GoogleCloudSamples.Controllers.BooksController.Index(string nextPageToken) Line 37    C#
    [External Code] 
```

Visual Studio doesn't show me a stack trace for any of the other threads:

```
Not Flagged     6236    88  Worker Thread   <No Name>       Normal
Not Flagged     5868    1   Worker Thread   <No Name>       Normal
Not Flagged     5176    0   Worker Thread   <No Name>       Normal
Not Flagged     6204    2   Worker Thread   <No Name>       Highest
Not Flagged     8292    0   Worker Thread   <No Name>       Normal
Not Flagged     6092    0   Worker Thread   <No Name>       Normal
Not Flagged     8448    7   Worker Thread   grpc 0  [Managed to Native Transition]  Normal
Not Flagged     6952    9   Worker Thread   grpc 2  [Managed to Native Transition]  Normal
Not Flagged     9172    10  Worker Thread   grpc 3  [Managed to Native Transition]  Normal
Not Flagged     9260    0   Worker Thread   <No Name>       Normal
Not Flagged     8488    77  Worker Thread   <No Name>       Normal
Not Flagged     7068    82  Worker Thread   Worker Thread   Grpc.Core.dll!Grpc.Core.Internal.CompletionQueueSafeHandle.Pluck    Normal
Not Flagged     9944    89  Worker Thread   <No Name>       Normal
Not Flagged     8444    92  Worker Thread   <No Name>       Normal
Not Flagged >   8188    87  Worker Thread   grpc 0  Grpc.Core.dll!Grpc.Core.Internal.CompletionQueueSafeHandle.Next Normal
Not Flagged     9132    81  Worker Thread   grpc 1  Grpc.Core.dll!Grpc.Core.Internal.CompletionQueueSafeHandle.Next Normal
Not Flagged     5224    79  Worker Thread   grpc 2  Grpc.Core.dll!Grpc.Core.Internal.CompletionQueueSafeHandle.Next Normal
Not Flagged     1808    78  Worker Thread   grpc 3  Grpc.Core.dll!Grpc.Core.Internal.CompletionQueueSafeHandle.Next Normal
Not Flagged     0   0   Unknown Thread  [Thread Destroyed]      
Not Flagged     0   0   Unknown Thread  [Thread Destroyed]      
Not Flagged     0   0   Unknown Thread  [Thread Destroyed]      
```
Is there a pointer to the code that calls the hanging RPC, or a little more context on this please?

Is there possibly be a log message saying: "Exception occured while invoking completion delegate."?

Thinking it could be due to task not getting filled in the blocking UnaryCall, if an exception goes off in its call to HandleUnaryResponse.

Now, I see timeouts instead of hangs.  Again, this is very flaky behavior.  I never know whether it will work, hang, or timeout.

Server Error in '/' Application.

Status(StatusCode=DeadlineExceeded, Detail="Deadline Exceeded")

Description: An unhandled exception occurred during the execution of the current web request. Please review the stack trace for more information about the error and where it originated in the code. 

Exception Details: Grpc.Core.RpcException: Status(StatusCode=DeadlineExceeded, Detail="Deadline Exceeded")

Source Error: 

Line 121:                query.StartCursor = Google.Protobuf.ByteString
Line 122:                    .CopyFromUtf8(nextPageToken);
Line 123:            FixedSizePage<Entity> firstPage = _db.RunQuery(query).AsPages()
Line 124:                .WithFixedSize(pageSize).First();
Line 125:            var books = firstPage.Select(result => result.ToBook());

I just posted a PR as to my guess at this problem. Might be able to try this out.
Is it ok to say that this is resolved in the same way that https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/7496 is resolved?

@apolcyn: No, #7496 was just accidentally misfiled. It's now https://github.com/google/google-api-dotnet-client/issues/775. We don't know the definite cause of either of them - it could be the same, or it could be different :(

The call to cq.Pluck() in UnaryCall never returns.

Wahoo!  I captured a grpc trace for a hang.


Something else that's funny here: the time on the created call in the above log looks like 1469228794 seconds. The default time that we're expecting to be using for total backoff is 30 seconds?
@apolcyn: I believe that's a deadline rather than a timeout. So 1469228794 is 2016-07-22T23:06:34Z - which looks like it's 3 seconds after the call starts, so it's starting with a 3 second timeout.
After I upgraded to the latest version of the nuget packages about 24 hours ago, I haven't seen this bug.
